name: U.I.J Hotel&Hostel (UIJ)
detail: We stayed at UIJ for a night on our trip to Tainan. The hotel is in the centre of the city and is very close to many attractions (and food!). UIJ only just started this March but is already very well run. The room was beautifully decorated. We have a record player in our room and countless vinyl records to choose from at the reception. Still and sparkling water plus free re-fill! I thought it was a nice touch. All the toiletries were of the highest quality. Breakfast was standard, but I thought it was quite nice to have local food as an option. The greatest part of this hotel has to be its staff! All of them were being extremely friendly and helpful. The service was greater than many 5 star hotels! Very well done! An extremely impressive hotel. Will definitely stay there again next year when we do our annual visit to Tainan!

name: Hotel Leisure Tainan
detail: That's what my buddies on this trip said. It set the bar high! As for me, I have contacted them about my bicycle needing parking space, I was on a solo Taiwan west coast cycling trip, and they have accommodated me. Staff are nice and kind, the place is well maintained.

name: H Villa Inn
detail: Not necessarily a good fit for foreigners. Way way outside town and staff are generally friendly but not used to foreigners. It’s a motel for a more specific purpose and while the rooms are nicely done and the shower is great, impractical for most tourism purposes in Tainan.

name: Tie Dao Hotel
detail: We chose the Tai Dao hotel both for its location, just opposite the Tainan train station, and its very reasonable price! We were travelling from Chiayi to Tainan by train, then onwards to Kaohsiung also by train, so the location was ideal. Exiting the train station, you are confronted with a very large and very busy roundabout - this serves in part as Tainan’s bus terminal. Looking across the road you’ll see the building in which the Tai Dao hotel is located, on the right side of the roundabout when facing it from the train station. There are two underpasses from the train station, those with heavy luggage should take the one on the left side of the roundabout as this one has lifts, up and down - then cross two intersections (controlled by lights) to get to the tall curved building that houses the Tai Dao hotel (plus a couple of food outlets, a 7Eleven, another hotel, and more). The Tai Dao hotel reception is on the ground floor to the right side of the building when facing the building. The underpass on the right side of the roundabout will bring you out closer to the hotel, but the steps are quite steep! With its location, you have easy access to trains and buses in Tainan, plus plenty of taxis readily available. The bus that takes you to the Flower Night Market (Tainan’s largest) stops right outside the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants in the streets around the hotel, and you can walk to many of the sights for which Tainan is renowned (we walked to the Confucius Temple, to the Chihkan Tower, and more). Check in was quick and easy. We were advised that each day we would need to present at reception to collect our breakfast vouchers for the following day. Breakfast vouchers included two coffee/tea vouchers plus two TWD60 coupons for use at the 7Eleven. We found the TWD60 was more than enough for a decent breakfast to start the day. We could get up to four sandwiches, or two hot meals (pre-packaged, heated up when purchased), or a number of buns/cakes - we certainly didn’t go hungry. The included coffee was the equivalent of a large coffee by Perth (Australia) standards. To get to the rooms you can either take the lift in the hotel’s lobby to the third floor, then switch to the building’s main lifts (unless of course you’re staying on the 3rd floor, we were on level 12 or 13), or walk around the front of the building, enter the building’s main lobby, and take the building’s own lifts directly to your floor. Our room was quite spacious, with two firm twin beds. There was a bench seat by the window that served as both a handy place to pop our cases, or a spot to city watch from on high. The room included efficient airconditioning, a mini fridge, and TV. The walls of the rooms are curved, which takes a little getting used, in that your beds are neatly pushed against the wall, but are not straight. The room was very clean, even when we moved one of the beds to get some distance (yes, we both snore), the floor under the beds was as clean as the rest of the floor! As an aside, with so very many rooms, we found that unless you specifically made note to reception that you wanted your room cleaned / made up, it didn’t happen every day. We passed the cleaning ladies in the corridors daily, while they didn’t speak a bit of English, they were very friendly and smiley (one even wanted a selfie with us)! On one day that our room wasn’t made up, we requested new towels, a bit difficult with no shared language, but we got there in the end and they were more than happy to oblige. If travelling with kids, do watch out for channels 14-17 as these are adult channels (we are a mother and daughter travelling together, it was an uncomfortable moment as I was flicking through channels, very quickly realising when channel 14 came on that this was not something I should be watching with my Mum, and even worse when I quickly changed channel and found the same genre on the next three channels - much relief was felt once I got back to “regul

name: Provintia Hotel
detail: We came to tainan with our parents and we booked two rooms. Both we and our parents agreed that it was the best rooms that we had during our stay in taipei and tainan. It was very convenient as it is located in the city with convenient stores,market and a popular bread shop at the neighbour. Rooms were spacious so were the toilet.Modern furnishings and quality.We enjoyed the buffet breakfast too.Highly reccomended!

name: LakeShore Hotel Tainan
detail: Very new hotel, location is okay but not as convenient as Silk Place. The room space is reasonable but there’s only curtains for bathroom which is so not attractive to me since I’m traveling w family. People outside if they peak, they could actually see you using toilets which is a big No for me. Besides, there’s no business center and I need to send document to the hotel so they can print it out for me downstairs at the lobby where everyone looks at you talking about printing documents. That’s another No for me. Overall I don’t think I’ll come back again since there are many other good choices of hotels in Tainan. But it’s good value for the room rate for sure.

name: Kindness Hotel Tainan Chihkan Tower
detail: Strongly agree with comment from Mr Tan earlier. My family and I had a short 3D2N stay at Kindness Hotel Tainan Chihkan Tower from 22 Mar 16 to 24 Mar 16 and this has to be one of the best Hotels in Taiwan we ever had! The Hotel is just about 5mins cab drive from Tainan Railway Train Station (~NT$100) and about 30mins cab drive from Tainan High Speed Railway Station (~NT$400). Amazed by the wide variety of food available for supper (even dan zai mian!) and also free snacks and drinks available 24hr (e.g. tea, coffee, ice cream). And most importantly, we felt welcomed and homely during our stay in Kindness! Their staff are very patient, helpful and polite! Would also like to take the opportunity to thank Mr Xu during our 2 nights stay. He has been extremely kind, helpful and even though we had approached him late at night for assistance, he has been smiley and very patient with us! He has offered several itineraries to us based on his knowledge and assisted us to make arrangement for transportation within a short notice. Next day he saw us, he has also asked for our feedback on our day trip. Excellent services, keep up the good work! Definitely will return and strongly recommend this Hotel to all!

name: Finders Hotel Tainan Ximen
detail: They upgraded us to a family room which was a nice touch!

name: LIHO Hotel Tainan
detail: It was my second time i stay at this hotel in Tainan. Very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel located just around 5 minutes walk from Chikan Lou and other attractions. Highly recommended.

name: Silks Place Tainan
detail: I am a loyal SPG member, but due to the fact that there is no SPG hotels in Tainan, I chose Silks Place Tainan for my stay. And I am thoroughly impressed. From the front desk to the executive lounge check-in, staff attitude and thoughtfulness, room decor, comfort and cleanliness...all these were impeccable and may even outshine certain SPG hotels I have stayed in Taipei. The only qualm is that room service is only up to 10pm, and though the food is very good (beef noodles..yum!), the selection is very limited. Would be good to extend or have have some simple late night room service menu, and a wider selection will be nice. Overall, I think it is a very professional hotel!
